Description: Create initial project timeline for Tuesday review with Andy. Bring both printed and digital copies to meeting.
Develop 1-page Specific Aims and detailed outline following BME format requirements for PhD proposal.
MILESTONE: Send initial proposal draft to advisor for review before Monday deadline.
Identify committee members; confirm availability; and schedule oral exam date. Reserve room for exam.
Develop 12-page Research Strategy section from outline following BME proposal guidelines.
MILESTONE: Oral exam date scheduled. Must send final proposal to committee ≥2 weeks prior to exam.
Achieve ≥30 mW output in fiber core (pre-pump configuration) for stable laser operation.
Restore amplified output to ≥130 mW (previous benchmark performance level).
Verify ≤200 fs pulse duration and record specifications in equipment log.
Align imaging system using USAF target for optimal resolution before in vivo experiments.
MILESTONE: Laser output and imaging optics meet all requirements for live animal imaging.
Plan ~3 pilot mice cohort with IACUC protocol confirmation and surgery slot booking.
Complete yearly graduate student progress report (department form) due early September.
Complete and submit all required committee forms for proposal defense.
Develop detailed Program of Work document outlining research timeline and requirements.
Book and confirm exam room logistics for proposal defense date.
Submit all completed paperwork to graduate office and confirm exam scheduling.
Design and order AAV-mScarlet (vascular) and jRGECO1b (neuronal) vectors. Finalize constructs and submit production orders to core facility.
MILESTONE: AAV vectors received from core facility. Ready for in vivo animal injections to begin expression studies.
Write full proposal document (~13 pages) including all aims and research strategy for committee review.
MILESTONE: Email proposal to committee ≥2 weeks before exam date (satisfies pre-exam requirement).
Create slide deck and practice oral exam presentation. Aim for two practice runs with lab members.
Qualifying Exam: Defend dissertation proposal in oral exam with committee members.
Incorporate committee revisions into proposal and submit signed approval form for final approval.
Install cranial window and inject AAV in first pilot mouse. Begin expression timeline for vascular labeling.
Monitor and medicate Mouse #1 after surgery. No imaging during recovery period to allow healing.
Install cranial window and inject AAV in second pilot mouse (staggered one week after #1).
Monitor and medicate Mouse #2 after surgery. Maintain analgesia schedule during recovery.
Install cranial window and inject AAV in third pilot mouse (further staggered timing).
Monitor and medicate Mouse #3 after surgery. Complete recovery period before imaging.
Acquire in vivo images for Mouse #1 comparing AAV fluorescence vs traditional dye injection methods.
Acquire in vivo images for Mouse #2 under dual-label vs dye conditions for comparison.
Acquire in vivo images for Mouse #3. Complete final pilot dataset for Aim 1 validation.
MILESTONE: Three pilot two-photon imaging datasets acquired for Aim 1 validation and proposal figures.
Perform image registration and SNR analysis. Calculate contrast metrics and refine imaging protocols.
Begin developing automated image segmentation pipeline using U-Net architecture for vascular features.
Tune microscope optics for dual-channel two-photon imaging and configure LSCI for blood flow measurements.
Design and order enhanced-expression AAV with tissue-specific enhancer for improved dual-label imaging (Aim 2).
MILESTONE: Enhanced AAV vector received and ready for in vivo testing to continue Aim 2 studies.
Systematically compare imaging depth; SNR; and contrast across different labeling methods (AAV vs dye) in vivo.
Write manuscript on AAV-based vascular imaging methodology and pilot results from Aim 1 studies.
Submit Aim 1 imaging methodology paper to journal for peer review and publication consideration.
Complete training and IACUC approval for stroke induction method (photothrombosis). Ensure all regulatory approvals are in place.
Perform stroke induction surgeries on experimental animal cohort to initiate Aim 3 longitudinal imaging study.
Conduct two-photon + LSCI imaging sessions in acute phase (0-1 week post-stroke) to capture immediate vascular changes.
Conduct imaging sessions during subacute transition phase (2-4 weeks post-stroke) to capture evolving vascular dynamics.
Conduct imaging sessions in early chronic phase (5-8 weeks post-stroke) to observe vascular remodeling processes.
Conduct imaging at ~12 weeks post-stroke (if needed) to capture long-term vascular remodeling and recovery patterns.
Adapt and improve machine learning segmentation pipeline for stroke dataset analysis and vascular feature detection.
MILESTONE: Completion of all planned longitudinal imaging sessions for stroke study (Aim 3).
Combine LSCI blood flow metrics with two-photon structural/functional data for comprehensive vascular analysis.
Quantify microvascular network changes and neurovascular coupling dynamics from post-stroke imaging data.
Create talk/poster for conference presentation (SPIE or neuroscience meeting) showcasing Year 5-6 research results.
Write second research paper covering dual-color imaging platform and initial stroke study findings (Aim 2/3).
Submit second major manuscript (Aim 2/3 results) to journal for peer review and publication consideration.
Complete yearly graduate student progress review (department form) with advisor due early September.
Complete dissertation write-up; final defense; and all graduation requirements by Summer 2027.
Write dissertation Introduction chapter including literature review and study rationale for PhD thesis.
Write chapter detailing Aim 1 (AAV imaging) methods; experiments; and results for dissertation.
Write chapter detailing Aim 2 (dual-color imaging platform) methods and results for dissertation.
Write chapter detailing Aim 3 (stroke model imaging study) methods; data; and findings for dissertation.
Write final dissertation chapter summarizing findings; implications; and future research directions.
MILESTONE: Complete PhD dissertation draft compiled and ready for committee review.
Defend PhD dissertation in oral exam with committee (must occur ≥2 weeks before final submission deadline).
Incorporate committee feedback and revisions after defense. Obtain final approval signatures.
Upload approved dissertation PDF and submit all required forms to Graduate School by deadline.
